verses.roman:
eka eka dantera kampa dekhite lāge bhaya
loke jāne, danta saba khasiyā paḍaya

synonyms: eka eka—one after another; dantera—of teeth; kampa—movement; dekhite—to see; lāge—there is; bhaya—fear; loke jāne—the people understood; danta—the teeth; saba—all; khasiyā—being loosened; paḍaya—fall down.
translation: Indeed, the people became afraid just to see His teeth chatter, and they even thought that His teeth would fall out.
